title: RNE - Open r
content:
Bold, clear thought it was pompei but it's not. Any help appreciated. Thank you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [RNE.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130016/http:/typophile.com/files/RNE.png) | 129.44 KB |
author: peterfwyang

comments.content: After a bunch of looking I think it is Pompei with a custom R. Just an easy edit in Illustrator.

That was the conclusion I was about to post as well. Here is a link to [Pompei](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130016/http:/www.fonts.com/font/monotype/pompei-new). You can see the P is open, but I think Bob's suggestion is the simplest way.

- Mike Yanega
+1 on Bob' suggestion - I can't find anything closer
Thanks all. I think this must be a custom weight of pompei as the serifs are different in Pompei and Pompei New.

I think the main point is that we seem to be in agreement that you could create this RNE lettering starting with Pompei and editing it. That means chopping off parts of serifs and cutting out part of the bowl of the R. Even adding stroke thickness, if necessary. The serifs on your E look like Pompei's E, but with some parts cut away. The fact that the N also goes below the baseline in your sample adds to the choice of Pompei as the starting point.

- Mike Yanega
